logicalTable.name: D6 Customers (Snowflakes)
logicalTable.description:
This logical table maps to the physical Customer Dimension table with various attributes like Customer Name, Status, Type and so on.
It maps to 3 LTS and showcases snowflake dimension modelling.
LTS1 Customers - Maps to the lowest grain of information.
LTS2 Customer Segments - Maps to higher grain of information. Every customer belongs to a customer segment.
LTS3 Customer Adresses - Maps to higher grain of information.

logicalColumns.name: C0  Customer Number
logicalColumns.description:
Help : 
Customer Key is an integer that uniquely identifies each record in the Customer dimension table.

logicalColumns.name: C19  Months as Customer
logicalColumns.description:
Help : 
Stores the customer's first contact date in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

logicalExpression.expressionTemplate: TIMESTAMPDIFF( SQL_TSI_MONTH , %1,  CAST ( VALUEOF(NQ_SESSION.%2) AS DATE ))
expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App Exa.D6 Customers (Snowflakes).C12  First Contact Date
variable:LAST_REFRESH_DT.LAST_REFRESH_DT

logicalHierarchies.name: H6 Customers [branch at level 'Customers Segment']
logicalHierarchies.description:
Customer Dimension:
Type - Skipped Levels
Includes 4 drill paths
1) Segment->Detail
2) Region->Area->Country->State->City->Postal Code->Detail
3) Geo Country->Geo State->Geo City->Geo Coordinates->Detail
4) Type->Status->Detail
